intro: Burmeistera serraniaguae, commonly known as the Sierra Madre burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It is a perennial herb that produces both blue and white flower colors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
